By  Marc AlbertsNovember  

Brad Burzynski was chosen Tuesday to be the seventy-sixth districts next State Representative PERIOD

With  percent of the precincts counted Burzynski was ahead of Democratic opponent Robert Tisch  votes to  votes PERIOD

Burzynski said he hoped tonight is the start of something good at his campaign headquarters in Sycamore PERIOD

Burzynski also spoke about the rigors of a  month campaign including a difficult primary battle where he was the underdog PERIOD

Tisch said he talked to Burzynski on the phone to congratulate him about midnight PERIOD

Brad and I agreed we came close to running a campaign the way it should be run Tisch said PERIOD

Tisch said he was pleased to have run a campaign not built on dividing people from each other. burzynski and Tisch have both run an issuesoriented campaign that refrained from the negative advertising that characterized many of this years races PERIOD

The candidates strongest area of disagreement was in the area of abortion PERIOD Burzynski took a prolife stand while Tisch said he is prochoice PERIOD

Both candidates spoke about the need to cut waste in the state government PERIOD Tisch wanted to consolidate certain state agencies for easier access PERIOD Burzynski proposed cutting overlapping law enforcement agencies PERIOD

Burzynski is the Governmental Affairs director of the DeKalb County Farm Bureau PERIOD He previously has managed Farm Bureaus in Clark and Clinton counties PERIOD
